instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no backlight
threads.message:
Hi,

got this macbook with no backlight. LVDS connector around <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> pins was totally burned. Replaced the connector, got backlight back but no image. Mac is working fine with external monitor via displayport. Also tried another good display, no image still. What to measure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no backlight
threads.message: White screen or dark screen with backlight present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage, no backlight
threads.message: No 3V to LCD so either dead L9004 or dead <CHIP>U9000</CHIP>.
